body_html:
I was able to solve it by changing the bazel build rules.

bazel build -c opt //tensorflow/g3doc/how_tos/adding_an_op:zero_out_op_kernel_1.so
bazel test //tensorflow/g3doc/how_tos/adding_an_op:zero_out_1_test

These commands worked properly (the ones given in the documentation didn't). So I got an idea from these to solve my issue.

But I am still not able to include the module without specifying an absolute path. How to solve that problem?
body_text:

But I am still not able to include the module without specifying an absolute path. How to solve that problem?
body:
I was able to solve it by changing the bazel build rules. 

bazel build -c opt //tensorflow/g3doc/how_tos/adding_an_op:zero_out_op_kernel_1.so
bazel test //tensorflow/g3doc/how_tos/adding_an_op:zero_out_1_test

These commands worked properly (the ones given in the documentation didn't). So I got an idea from these to solve my issue.

But I am still not able to include the module without specifying an absolute path. How to solve that problem?
